title: Authors and Citation
text: Elio Campitelli. Maintainer, author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Campitelli E (2024). rhelpi18n: Adds Support por Multilingual Help Pages. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://eliocamp.github.io/rhelpi18n/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rhelpi18n: Adds Support por Multilingual Help Pages},   author = {Elio Campitelli},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://eliocamp.github.io/rhelpi18n/}, }

what: Adds Support por Multilingual Help Pages
title: Adds Support por Multilingual Help Pages
text: repository documents proposal support internationalisation R help pages. project started 2023 R Project Sprint. issue.

title: Adds Support por Multilingual Help Pages
text: Install package: Next install translation module. base.es package hosts translations base::mean() example, install Setting LANGAUGE environmental variable “es” change R language. Now base::mean()’s help page displayed Spanish. work HTML documentation displayed R GUIs like RStudio, well text documentation displayed R console.

title: Adds Support por Multilingual Help Pages
text: First get copy package want translate. Choose translation language ISO 2-letter code eventually regional option using underscore: example Spanish language = "es", Argentine Spanish language = "es_AR". use rhelpi18n::i18n_module_create() create lang translation module package translation string saved yaml files, one per Rd file original package. can find “path//module/translations” format: can distribute package translators. translation, replace completed yaml files folder. Build package test. ’s .
code: rhelpi18n::i18n_module_create(module_name = "package.lang",                                language = "lang",                                module_path = "path/to/module",                                package_path = "path/to/package") title:   original: Title in the original language   translation: ~

title: Adds Support por Multilingual Help Pages
text: received yaml files, replace ~ translation field translation original field, like exemple: Problems ’s clear page translation “official” one. ’s possible access original documentation without changing LANGUAGE environmental variable opening help page . formatting issues, ... argument name.
code: title:   original: Title in the original language   translation: Título en la lengua original

title: Gets translation modules — get_translation_modules
text: Lists package names modules translates particular package particular language

title: Gets translation modules — get_translation_modules
text: package character string name package language character string language

title: Creates a translation module — i18n_module_create
text: Creates translation module skeleton form source package translation templates original strings proper functions load translations.

title: Creates a translation module — i18n_module_create
code: i18n_module_create(   module_name = NULL,   language,   module_path = file.path(".", module_name),   package_path,   rstudio_project = TRUE )

title: Creates a translation module — i18n_module_create
text: module_name Name translation module. needs valid package name. missing, created name package.language. language Language translation module module_path Path module created. package_path Path package translated. rstudio_project Logical indicating whether create .Rproj file.

title: Creates templates for translation — i18n_translation_templates
text: Grabs .Rd files creates yaml templates translate.

title: Creates templates for translation — i18n_translation_templates
text: rd_files character vector rd files. folder folder save templates. created exist.

title: Creates templates for translation — i18n_translation_templates
code: rd_files <- system.file("extdata", "periodic.Rd", package = "rhelpi18n") template_folder <- tempdir() i18n_translation_templates(rd_files, template_folder) #> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/rhelpi18n/extdata/periodic.Rd  #>                               "/tmp/RtmpNF3AIv/periodic.yaml"

text: path vector paths depth positive integer indicating component extract. 0 means last component, 1 means parent .

text: x flattened rd object. ... ignored.

what: Write and read a flattened rd file — rd_flat_write
title: Write and read a flattened rd file — rd_flat_write
text: Reads yaml file translations list. list used translate strings runtime.

title: Write and read a flattened rd file — rd_flat_write
Write and read a flattened rd file — rd_flat_write
text: rd_flat rd_flattened file returned [rd_flatten]. file Yaml file translations

title: Write and read a flattened rd file — rd_flat_write
text: rd_flat_write writes result [rd_flatten] yaml file can used translation. rd_flat_read reads file result can used translation [rd_translate].

title: Reformats the Rd structure — rd_flatten
text: Rd structure returned tools::parse_Rd utils::.getHelpfile() can nested ideal translation. rd_flatten "flattens" structure simpler list rd_unflatten goes back original structure.

title: Reformats the Rd structure — rd_flatten
text: Rd parsed Rd file returned tools::parse_Rd utils::.getHelpfile(). untranslatable character vector fields translated. rd_flat flattened Rd file.

title: Translates an Rd object — rd_translate
text: Takes object returned [tools::parse_Rd] utils::.getHelpfile() translates strings.

title: Translates an Rd object — rd_translate
text: Rd Rd object translation flattened rd object returned [rd_flatten] , likely, [rd_flat_read].

title: Translates an Rd object — rd_translate
text: Rd object translated strings.

what: Read translations from a directory — read_translations
title: Read translations from a directory — read_translations
text: Read translations directory

title: Read translations from a directory — read_translations
Returns matching languages — resolve_lang
text: Returns matching languages

title: Returns matching languages — resolve_lang
text: languages character vector languages. target_language single character string desired language.

title: Returns matching languages — resolve_lang
text: logical vector length languages indicating language match target_language

title: Returns matching languages — resolve_lang
text: take account ISO hierarchy. .e.: target_language "es_AR", "es" good, "es_AR" better. target language "es", "es_AR" also good. Right now returns TRUE exact matches matches, returns TRUE elements language root language target_language. target_language "es_AR", "es_UY", "es_ES" "es" return TRUE.
